definition: the end/an ending/to wind down/to conclude
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly

sentences.english: One survey found that 60 percent of marriage that occur in old age end in divorce.
sentences.chinese: 一項大衆調查表明，60%的晚婚都以離婚收場。

sentences.english: MESSY end to Greece's debt crisis seems ever more plausible.
sentences.chinese: 希臘債務危機草草收場似乎比以往來得更有理有據。

sentences.english: She spoke amiably, yet with the least hint of dismissal in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她親切地說，但話音裏有一點收場的暗示。

sentences.english: Why the backpedaling on more and more scientific research?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼越來越多的科學論文以撤銷爲收場？

sentences.english: The World Cup opening game ends in a tie/draw .
sentences.chinese: 世界盃揭幕戰以平局收場。

sentences.english: Cowperwood was in no way pleased by this rough denouement.
sentences.chinese: 這樣草草收場，柯帕烏絕不會高興的。

sentences.english: Our exhiBition centre provides sites free of rent for exhiBition and sale of products.
sentences.chinese: 本展覽中心提供展銷場地，不收場地租借費。

sentences.english: The tragedy is the majority of such attempts fail.
sentences.chinese: 可悲的是，這種努力大多以失敗收場。

sentences.english: Do half of all marriages really end in divorce?
sentences.chinese: 世上一半的婚姻最終會以離婚收場？

sentences.english: Italian way for celebrating everything ends up with a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 義大利式的任何慶祝活動都會以一杯咖啡收場。

sentences.english: At the same time you will probably end up hating yourself.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，你可能將以恨你自己收場。

sentences.english: This phase relates to the process of escalating, isolating and closing.
sentences.chinese: 這個階段和升級，隔離和收場相關聯。

sentences.english: The weakest students can end up with a negative score.
sentences.chinese: 最差的學生可能會以負分收場。

sentences.english: At the end, there still need ending after bustling, the organizers still have a lot of work.
sentences.chinese: 曲終人散，繁華過後還得收場，組織者仍有許多工作。

sentences.english: How many Frenchmen does it take to defend Paris?
sentences.chinese: 願意守護巴黎的法國人收場有幾多人呢？

sentences.english: The play got terrible reviews and quickly died a death.
sentences.chinese: 這齣戲被批得一無是處，很快就收場了。

definition: final/ultimate
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to turn back/to reverse
opponent/rival/competitor/(well-matched) adversary/match
fault/mistake/to miss (a chance)
end/conclusion/to come to an end/to terminate (sth)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
to suffer a crushing defeat
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
to confront/to face
item (on a program)
bilateral/both sides/both parties involved
to owe a debt/the sum owed
to quarrel/dispute
